txt.en: 'All we can be certain of is that he wants to gather the Dead and use them against Gondor!'
'You speak true....'
'It is decided then. If we are to survive, we must secure Lancrath and Tingobel.'
'Endeavour to learn more of this man while you are there...'
'Long ago, trees spread to all corners of the vale...'
'...for I fear he shall not tarry in the vale should he succeed in rallying the Dead.'
Instance: The Cursed Vale
'...save for the top of the great Hill where the Stone of Erech rests.'
'Isildur himself brought it to the vale, and there it remains.'
'It stood as a reminder of his heritage and of lands to which he could never return...'
'...but now, it is thought of only as a symbol of oaths broken.'
'The Men he cursed betrayed not only Gondor, but the whole of the Last Alliance.'
'And so they paid dearly... their cowardice led their people to ruin and eternal unrest.'
'The Hill has since been a place of unease to our people, but in times of great distress, the Dead themselves return and haunt the Stone.'
'This war has again drawn them forth, but to what end, I cannot be certain.'
'...and a Man swears to free them from their curse.'
'As our forests receded to the edges of the vale, our troubles grew and the Dead could no longer be ignored.'
'You spoke of worrisome things, [placeholder]....'
'Then perhaps he seeks to deceive them...'
'I think it is time you share them with us.'
'In their cowardice, they betrayed the Dark Lord as well.'
'He will travel eastward toward the Stone then, and so [placeholder] should follow his path.'
'Do not forget... there remains the matter of the Orcs in Tingobel as well, Malthellam.'
'To fight a war on two fronts shall only bring us to ruin!'
'Very well, let us speak...'
'The Dead wander beyond the Stone and fill beasts with madness....'
'Preposterous! He cannot be Isildur's heir, so the Dead would never obey him!'
'Malthellam, [placeholder] and I are waiting for you....'
'You are supposing too much, Rosfin!'
'We know little of this Man, his army in Tarlang's Crown, and even less of the power he wields.'
